channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: This Bizarre Star System Is Inside Out, and Astronomers Aren’t Sure How
item.description: A closer look at the planets around a star called LHS 1903 may just flip our understanding of how planetary systems form.

item.title: La première bêta d’Android 17 est finalement arrivée
item.description: Après un retard à l'allumage, Google a livré ce vendredi soir la première bêta d'Android 17. Destinée aux développeurs équipés d'un smartphone Pixel compatible, cette version n'est pas très riche en nouveautés — mais elle prépare le terrain à celles qui arrivent.

item.title: A Dating App Based on Users’ Credit Scores Is Making a Comeback
item.description: Just ahead of Valentine's Day, Score wants to be more inclusive.

item.title: Bitcoin biopic starring Casey Affleck to use AI to generate locations and tweak performances
item.description: Killing Satoshi, an upcoming biopic about the elusive creator of Bitcoin, will reportedly rely heavily on artificial intelligence to generate locations and adjust actors' performances, Variety reports. The film was announced in 2025 as being directed by Doug Liman (The Bourne Identity, The Edge of Tomorrow) and starring Casey Affleck and Pete Davidson in undisclosed roles, but its connection to overhyped technology was previously understood to begin and end with cryptocurrency.According to a UK casting notice viewed by Variety, the producers of Killing Satoshi reserve the right to "change, add...

item.title: China has extracted 1000g of uranium from just seawater - targets "unlimited battery life" by 2050, tapping into 4.5 billion tons of aquatic uranium
item.description: The oceans hold vast uranium resources, and China’s recent extraction milestone is a start but does not yet ensure a large-scale fuel supply.

item.title: Fintech lending giant Figure confirms data breach
item.description: The company said hackers downloaded “a limited number of files” after breaking into an employee’s account. The hacking group ShinyHunters took responsibility for the breach.

item.title: 4chan’s creator says ‘Epstein had nothing to do’ with creating infamous far-right board /pol/
item.description: The close timing of Jeffrey Epstein coming into contact with 4chan founder Chris 'moot' Poole and the launch of the "politically incorrect" message board /pol/ that became a breeding ground for QAnon and the white supremacist alt-right movement was coincidental, says Poole. In a statement given to The Verge, Pool writes, "The decision to add […]

item.title: George R.R. Martin Makes Delightfully Terrible Mistake of Entrusting Major Spoilers to Small Child
item.description: Dexter Sol Ansell, who plays Egg on 'A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms,' shared some surprising insider info about main characters' futures.

item.title: The Verge’s 2026 Valentine’s Day gift guide (for him)
item.description: Valentine's Day is often thought of as the quintessential Hallmark holiday - and why wouldn't it be? Most of the time, it's marketed to us with massive floral arrangements and heart-shaped chocolates, both of which can come off as borderline twee. But no one says you have to play by the rulebook when it comes […]

item.title: Why top talent is walking away from OpenAI and xAI
item.description: AI companies have been hemorrhaging talent the past few weeks. Half of xAI’s founding team has left the company — some on their own, others through “restructuring” — while OpenAI is facing its own shakeups, from the disbanding of its mission alignment team to the firing of a policy exec who opposed its “adult mode” feature. Watch as TechCrunch’s Equity podcast hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony […]...

item.title: Bring KitchenAid's official color of the year into your home with mint green and brushed stainless steel accessories — from just $1.49
item.description: Drench your cooking space in this year's freshest color, paired with smart brushed stainless steel.

item.title: Corsair's pricey DDR5 RAM now comes in very different packaging — and it's all about foiling RAM scammers
item.description: Corsair is putting its high-end RAM in a sealed plastic clamshell to help prevent return-related scams.

item.title: I test smart home tech for a living, and these are the top 3 Ring alternative video doorbells I recommend, with local storage for your videos
item.description: With these wireless video doorbells you can avoid subscription fees and keep control of your recordings at home.

item.title: DIY Camera That Records on Cassette Tapes Takes Lo-Fi Tech Trends to a New Level
item.description: All the joy (and frustration) of 1983 at your fingertips!

item.title: The World Is on Fire, and Meta Sees an Opportunity to Add Facial Recognition to Smart Glasses
item.description: Meta reportedly hopes a 'dynamic political environment' will let them get away with a new surveillance network.

item.title: I tried to tell you about living in AI Time — this essay nails its harsh reality, and here's why we're not truly screwed
item.description: This is what it means to be living in AI Time and, based on a new essay by Matt Shumer, CEO and Co-Founder of Otherside, potentially how to survive it.

item.title: A mysterious Chinese company just teased its first cheap Micro Four Thirds camera – but don’t expect it to be an OM System killer
item.description: OM System has announced the entry of Chinese budget camera manufacturer Sonida into the Micro Four Thirds System, but the expected new Songdian-branded camera probably won't take on offerings from OM System or Lumix

item.title: Swiss scientists want to make long AI-generated videos even better by preventing them from 'degrading into randomness' - is that a good idea? I am not so sure
item.description: EPFL researchers teach AI to correct its own mistakes in video sequences, reducing drift and potentially extending realistic duration.

item.title: Dell's Presidents' Day sale is a goldmine for business professionals - these are the desktop and laptop deals worth checking out
item.description: Some great Windows 11 laptops and desktops get a big price-cut over at Dell.

item.title: Sex toys maker Tenga says hacker stole customer information
item.description: The Japanese sex toy maker said a hacker broke into an employee's inbox and stole customer names, email addresses, and correspondence, including order details and customer service inquiries.

item.title: ULA’s Vulcan Rocket Suffers Familiar Anomaly During Launch of US Military Satellites
item.description: Shortly after liftoff, an unusual plume shot out of one of the solid rocket boosters.

item.title: Measles 2026 update: These states are seeing new outbreaks as infections hit all-time highs
item.description: New data from the CDC shows there have already been nearly 1,000 confirmed cases of the disease this year. It’s only February, and an outbreak of measles infections is already inching toward nearly 1,000 cases this year in the U.S.

item.title: YouTube TV will soon offer cheaper bundles, including a new sports plan
item.description: YouTube TV is offering new plans that cost less than the main plan, which is priced at $82.99 per month.

item.title: The Audacity teaser promises sharp Silicon Valley satire
item.description: Jonathan Glatzer's ("Better Call Saul," "Succession") "The Audacity" skewers Silicon Valley CEOs. It premieres April 12 on AMC.

item.title: Social Security Workers Are Being Told to Hand Over Appointment Details to ICE
item.description: The recent request goes against decades of precedent and puts noncitizens at further risk of immigration enforcement actions.

item.title: Les grandes galaxies elliptiques contredisent-elle vraiment l'âge de l'Univers ?
item.description: Hubble, puis ensuite le James-Webb ont débusqué des grandes galaxies elliptiques tôt dans l'histoire du Cosmos, laissant certains avancer que l'Univers observable devait être plus âgé qu'on ne le pensait pour avoir eu le temps de faire naître ces galaxies. Mais est-ce bien le cas, surtout suite...

item.title: OpenAI Users Launch Movement to Save Most Sycophantic Version of ChatGPT
item.description: Right before Valentine's Day, too.

item.title: Two years of the NordVPN Complete plan is 70 percent off
item.description:
NordVPN is having a big sale on its two-year plans right now. The Complete tier, for example is 70 percent off, bringing the price of 24 months down to just $130. NordVPN regularly appears on Engadget’s list of the best VPN services thanks to its wide server network, strong security tools and consistent performance across devices. NordVPN’s latest promotion puts one of its most comprehensive plans at a price that undercuts many competing premium VPN subscriptions.
The Complete tier includes full access to NordVPN’s core VPN service, which encrypts internet traffic and masks a user’s IP addre...

item.title: 'We have to up our game' — Jon Favreau on taking The Mandalorian to the big screen
item.description: Jon Favreau explains why The Mandalorian & Grogu had to “up our game” for theaters — and teases what’s next for Grogu.

item.title: The see-through Beats Studio Buds Plus are more than 40 percent off for Presidents Day
item.description: If you like how well AirPods work with iPhones but want something more colorful and flexible, the Beats Studio Buds Plus are a nice middle ground. They’re platform-agnostic and are on sale for $99.95 ($70 off) at Amazon, Best Buy, Target, and Walmart for Presidents Day. The deal includes the eye-catching translucent option and is […]

item.title: Hasbro Celebrates ‘Transformers: The Movie’ by Apologizing for It
item.description: If you're still upset over 'Transformers: The Movie' whacking Optimus Prime, you've got a whole year to accept Hasbro's 'we're sorry.'

item.title: Who needs Netflix and Prime Video? These 4K Blu-ray starter packs can unlock the ultimate movie-watching experience
item.description: 4K Blu-ray provides the sort of quality streaming could never live up to – and these starter packs are all you need to experience the joy of UHD discs.

item.title: Binance France President Targeted in Latest Crypto Home Invasion
item.description: The wrench attacks will continue until moral improves.

item.title: Valve's latest Steam beta lets you add your PC's specs to game reviews
item.description: An upcoming update to Steam includes a helpful improvement to game reviews. As part of the Steam Client Beta update Valve released on February 12, users will now be able to attach information about their hardware specifications when they post a new game review or update an old one.It's not uncommon to find negative reviews that complain about a game's performance, information that's hard to draw a conclusion from without knowing what kind of hardware the reviewer is using. With specs attached, the usefulness of complaints becomes a little bit easier to gauge. A game's sales performance and dis...

item.title: How to watch NBA All-Star 2026: Live stream every game, TV channels
item.description: Basketball’s biggest names are ready for an all-out showdown. Here's how to watch NBA All-Star 2026 live streams in all parts of the world.

item.title: US Weather Pulls a Switcheroo
item.description: Finally, some snow for the West and warmer temperatures for the East.
